attributes.action: to initiate a form of medal, or commemorative badge, to be awarded to those members of H.M. Armed Forces who served their country during the Cold War.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is long overdue to initiate a form of medal, or commemorative badge, to be awarded to those members of H.M. Armed Forces who served their country during the Cold War. Recognition due to these veterans and their service differs greatly in nature from the normal recognition given to active service campaigns. 
The Cold War was one of deterrence with the emphasis on preventing a ‘shooting war’ from breaking out. Whereas any campaign of active service normally attracts it’s own campaign or General Service Medal there would have been few survivors of a Cold War that went ‘ hot’ 
Applying the conditions normally given, by senior officers, to the inauguration of a medal then only after the ‘mushroom clouds’ from this ‘hot’ war had cleared would, possibly, a few survivors from the Cold War have had their contribution recognised by an award.  
Different type of action ..different rules apply to instituting an award. Time this was put right!
